website_summaries.verdict: You can't get more bang for your video card buck than the Nvidia GeForce GTX 1070, a Pascal-based that has almost everything going for it.
pros: One of the best video card values on the market
cons: Founders Edition version adds a pointless price premium

website_summaries.verdict: The GTX 1070 Gaming Z is an almost perfect GTX 1070 variant for high-end gaming: fast, cool, and quiet, plus tweakable with clean, easy software. LED dressing seals the deal.
pros: Attractive design, including RGB LEDs, for PC builders with windowed cases
Reasonable pricing relative to other GTX 1070 cards
cons: Can't tweak the color of one of the LEDs
Lack of general availability at this writing

customer_reviews.title: Love this gfx card
customer_reviews.text: Love this gfx card, puts all game settings back to ultra. The only downside is that this card is a monster so be sure you have the space for it. I had to cut 3cm deep sections from the internal drive bay to allow it to fit. One other nice feature is the ability to change the led colour to suit your tower. I found the default drivers had not enabled this feature in the supplied software (Firestorm) but a bit of googling soon turned up the correct one to install (if you want it any colour other than the default pale blue).
customer_reviews.author: M. West

customer_reviews.title: A lot for your money
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money and an absolute beast of a card. As others have pointed out, great performance but also a great size. It is huge so make sure your case can accommodate it as it's 12.5" long, it's the porn star of graphics cards. Performance wise it certainly performs, bought it primarily to play Elite Dangerous which i now run fully maxed out with 2.0 supersampling and i'm getting 130 fps. Star Wars Battlefront is around the 200 fps mark with everything on. I love this card, not cheap, but then you get a lot for your money, plus the build quality is superb
customer_reviews.author: Gibbon

customer_reviews.title: Insane build quality, size too
customer_reviews.text: Bought the standard AMP edition for a friend and oh my this card is huge and heavy, making my own gigabyte 1080 looked small. The build quality is what impresses me the most. The metal back plate feels like an armour plate and the shroud is firm and solid. I was very confident handling this card knowing that it won't get a dent without a serious screwup. I haven't benched the thing yet but I can imagine it having no problem with thermals due to those bulky radiating fins.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Ouyang

customer_reviews.title: The best price to performance graphics card this year
customer_reviews.text: The best price to performance graphics card this year. Runs games with no struggle. VR is something I yet have to try but it will definately bring a great experience to that. This card is superior to the gtx 1080 hands down for your money. This is the sweet-spot for this year's line up from Nvidia.
customer_reviews.author: Macky

customer_reviews.title: Really great card.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice card, with a great amount of control via the Firestorm app. Big as hell. Firestrike with Ryzen 5 1600 and 16Gb DDR4 RAM@2400mhz was somewhere around 14,000, maybe above. Or maybe it was 17,000, can't remember, either or. It's quiet as a mouse too, unless you want to switch on manual fan control and blast it to 100%. Cools it down well too. I haven't put it to the test on modern games yet, but DDDA and Insurgency have been constant above 120fps (dips in DDDA though, but never below 80). With G-Sync I imagine that's not a problem, but I have a Freesync monitor because I'm dumb. Easily took the longest to ship.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size and function
customer_reviews.text: This is a walloping big GPU that will dominate any pc case and I think very expensive. However it does deliver the goods on my Xplane11 frame rate that is now well over 30fps with max settings and the GPU fans only running at 25% so lots of spare capability that should make this card usable for next five years and beyond. Have to say I think it looks great in the case but could probably do with support on the end. Will be retrofitting a support bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Tyke

customer_reviews.title: The 1080p Killer
customer_reviews.text: I was originally planning to get the MSI or EVGA founders edition but I thought I might take a gamble and purchase the founders edition from this brand... Needless to say I'm pleased with this card, the founders edition card look amazing, this card kills 1080p gaming as well as 1440p. Would recommend to anyone who wants to get into PC gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. JK

customer_reviews.title: The cooling system is the best I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Overclocks beyond 2000 mhz out of the box, mine reaches 2150 mhz. The cooling system is the best I've ever seen, I'm getting 60 degrees Celcius while card is manually overclocked and fans are running at 3-7% maximum. In less demanding games like CS:GO fans don't even turn on, thanks to massive radiator. With such high core clock this card is only like 4-6 fps behind gtx 1080 stock
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but large card.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent graphics card, my son loves it and is making a lot of use of it. Be warned it is very large, so will not be suitable for smaller cases. I had to get creative with the hard drive bays to make this fit in my sons case.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice version of the 1070
customer_reviews.text: I originally intended to buy an Evga ftw 1070 but read some negative reviews online concerning overheating issues and poor placement of cooling features. This is a fantastic card. Out of the box the boost clock registered at 2012 MHz. It runs silently and, at 1080p, is overkill for all games running in ultra graphics settings. I'm planning on running it at 1440p when my new monitor arrives. Overall I am more than happy with this purchase and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jared D.

customer_reviews.title: A Winner!
customer_reviews.text: It's big but it's not that big. It's powerful and it's very quiet under load and silent in idle. Sagging of the card in the PCI-e slot is minimal, card is pretty rigid.. my older smaller card sagged more. Basically i'm very happy i got this card it was a huge leap from a GTX 570. No more lag and everything looks how it should maxed out.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaDreams

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this card
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this card. Worth upgrading from an RX 480. I can now run all of my games at 1440p comfortably. It's very quiet but not silent but again quieter than the MSI 480. Nvidia drivers and applications seem far more functional and stable than AMDs. The card is a lot bigger than I expected but there was just enough room in my Fractal Design mini C case.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Amazing good looking GPU with extremely high proformance evreything i've ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing good looking GPU with extremely high performance everything I've thrown at it has been able to run at ultra settings no problem would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good apart from power lead split that's yellow/black
customer_reviews.text: Good apart from power lead split that's yellow/black. Messes up the black only lead setup I have going on. Performance wise this has replaced a 980M laptop so yep it's rather fast with mixture of high/ultra game settings
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: expensive but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: running an i5 2500 with only 8gb of ram and still flies through BF1 so even happier didn't need to upgrade rest of pc price paid was a lot sure things will drop after some time but worth the money paid 5 YEAR warranty was the clincher for me don't need to look at new card for a few years now as if it break will be under warranty as I don't overclock it cant see any issues
customer_reviews.author: hairygit

customer_reviews.title: looks amazing and the lighting is great
customer_reviews.text: Beast of a card, looks amazing and the lighting is great. Been running everyday for 3 months so far and no problems. Runs alongside my i7 4790k and plays anything you can throw at it; my current games are Battlefield 1, Forza Horizon 3, GTA 5, Arma 3, and Cities Skyline.
customer_reviews.author: Trebor

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for your bobs
customer_reviews.text: Serious bang for your buck..couldn't justify buying 1080 as there is not a lot in the difference
customer_reviews.author: ACE OF SPUDS ♤

customer_reviews.title: A Massive Monster of a GPU
customer_reviews.text: This is what you call a massive GPU. It takes up a huge chunk of space along with all the PCI slots you have. So if you want to have a dual GPU with Zotac, I wouldn't recommend it if you do plan to have utilise any of the other PCI slots (Intel 750 Series SSD). I ran out of space completely just with one as I am running two separate Intel 750 SSDs. I do suffer some issues with games where it will crash and freeze. Not sure if it's related to the GPU. But overall, I love how it looks! Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I didn't have much faith in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I didn't have much faith in the brand to be honest, but it totally blow me away with the speed. Gonna give some more time, but I'm really happy with the graphic card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's meant to do - no complaints, money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: CK1

customer_reviews.title: it works like a dream 1440p 60fps on most new games while ...
customer_reviews.text: it works like a dream 1440p 60fps on most new games while its still cool because of its 3 slot heat sink, I overclock it a bit but don't push it to much as i don't need to as it is so fast with the boost clock already. So happy I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The card is huge be carful with checking the dimensions
customer_reviews.text: It’s a huge card . It doesn’t fit in my desktop it’s just too massive it reminds me Of the 80s 70s I’m very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Hamza Boumediene

customer_reviews.title: Broke when idling and watching youtube... Wth.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a year of use, utter disappointment. No overclocking or anything.
customer_reviews.author: N527

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this graphic card The games run smooth on ultra settings It is also very big which looks amazing
customer_reviews.author: Kamil

customer_reviews.title: Gigantic
customer_reviews.text: This card is absolutely massive - like really, really huge Don't say I didn't warn you Unless you have a huge case you are probably going to need to measure first
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Top Card - Worth the PC Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Great card, now my pc runs smooth, runs all games with max/ultra settings. Very quick, even hits the top benchmark figures so definitely not disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Tillster123

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing company, amazing card - what more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome card. Its accepted everything I've thrown at it in 1440p
customer_reviews.author: Lucage

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: does everything you would expect. plays elite:dangerous at 1440p maxed settings no problem. very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyWalsh

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SLI's Zotac amp extreme
customer_reviews.text: so i had this card for about a month and then i bought another one, absolutely kills anything i throw at it and works great sli with i7 7700k.
customer_reviews.author: Trimster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great card very quite just fits in define r5 case without taking out hard drive cages
customer_reviews.author: Daniel O Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great for a quiet build
customer_reviews.text: I love how the fans turn off when not under load - It helps keep my system quiet.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Just what i  wanted
customer_reviews.text: Excellent very big and bulky only tested GW2 heart of thorns very big boost coming from 7950 also used with new monitor that i got along with this card Asus ROG Swift PG278Q wow i could never play wvw in gw2 very well always lagged out now its very smooth game play the best settings all the way up no problems very happy. I installed into mid tower case lots room near HDD cage no problem with the side panel the only annoying thing was the screws even with small fingers it was a pain i got there in the end also removed 3 pcie slots covers to give me room.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Can run games better and at higher quality settings at 4k than my gtx 660 can at 1080p
customer_reviews.text: Amazing performance can run some games in 4k at high settings at 60fps, Not ultra but certainly good settings! Fallout 4 4k high 50-60 fps+ Starwars battlefront 4k High 60fps+ - ultra at 40fps Watchdogs 1 4k mixed high / ultra at 60fps+ Can run games better and at higher quality settings at 4k than my gtx 660 can at 1080p Temps at default fan curve are in the mid 70's / low 80's Temps at custom defined fan curve are high 60's (around 67 / 68) A bit loud but i prefer the low temps + my headphones can block out the sound of the fans.
customer_reviews.author: Beryl

customer_reviews.title: I've just ordered a OR VR Unit as I believe this card will be even more amazing through this
customer_reviews.text: This card is superb. Playing everything in 4k and silky smooth so far. I've just ordered a OR VR Unit as I believe this card will be even more amazing through this. Cannot wait !!!!
customer_reviews.author: chumpy

customer_reviews.title: Stunning card, Capable of 4k gaming at around 50fps on maxed settings.
customer_reviews.text: Overclocks brilliantly +162mhz gpu and +216mhz memory clock from default. Probably can go more but running very stable at over 2000mhz gpu clock. Fan is efficient, keeps temps around 60c in my rig.
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Piece of beast but if you want to have LN Pc, will need to buy something like Arctic accelero IV etc.
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied, that is all I can write for now, needs more gaming Just one note about fans They are not louder than my 2x 140mm (front) and 1x 120mm (rear) Arctic freezer fans up to 45-50% then is noise more noticeable WILL UPDATE LATER
customer_reviews.author: HeiDs

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a good price. Granted I only run one monitor at 1080, so I don't tax my system and don't have trouble with over heating. But even if this was the case, you could purchase this product and a cooling case cheaper than one pre-assembled. I'm very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fan noise
customer_reviews.text: Works well, the temps stay constant at 52-60 under load. Though when the second fan starts spinning it creates this vibration noise and it's extremely annoying
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it but I hate the coil whine, even if it is barely audible.
customer_reviews.author: Fehok

customer_reviews.title: This card is great, perhaps the best value / performance on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing much to be said about this card that can't already be seen in numerous reviews and benchmarks. This card is great, perhaps the best value / performance on the higher end spectrum right now. For 1080p gaming this card can handle pretty much everything you throw at it with maxed out settings. Some of the games I tested were GTA V, Rise of the Tomb Raider, Witcher 3 and Far Cry Primal. Had no issues whatsoever running these games.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Azevedo

customer_reviews.title: overclocks nicely and it's beatifull
customer_reviews.text: although it's somewhat slow, i had no other problem with it. overclocks nicely and it's beatifull!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan the Greek

customer_reviews.title: card is great and worked fine
customer_reviews.text: Mine had a rumbling noise with the fans when they dropped below 40%, didn't seem right for something which cost over £400. Refunded it, card is great and worked fine. But i didn't like the rumbling sound, may have just been my card. Ended up getting a different 1070 which works great. Other than that the card is very big so be aware it wont fit in smaller cases.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Brackenridge Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great card, performs really well and quietly too was ...
customer_reviews.text: Great card, performs really well and quietly too was a much needed uprade from an AMD radeon 6950, only problem is its is a heavy card and may bend the pcie slot depending on how strong it is, not had a single problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO GAME CODE
customer_reviews.text: Great Graphics Card but the code for a free game never came with the box or seperatly (False advertising) so for anyone wanting this card for a free game I'd not bother.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: I recived gtx 1070 amp by memory tybe Micron bad memory in 4k
customer_reviews.text: I recived gtx 1070 amp by memory tybe Micron bad memory in 4k .. Im have to another card in sli by samsung tepe memory " performance gas been good "
customer_reviews.author: معاذ احمد
